channel.title: has anyone done this before
channel.description: so i was screwing around with music files for hl1 and i notice i had hl1 ps2 menu theme so i named the file gamestartup.mp3 and put it in the media folder of hl1 started hl1 and it works and i think it loops like it does in the ps2 version

item.title: has anyone done this before
item.dc:creator: lightninrod4
item.description:
the won version does have the tilting but on later updates the took in off

Read full topic

item.title: has anyone done this before
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Half-Life 2 is also minus the tilting.

Some Source games have an “sv_rollangle” command (I think it might be natively exclusive to MP builds), but by default it’s usually 0.

If memory serves, though, WON version of HL1 did have the tilting.

Read full topic

item.title: has anyone done this before
item.dc:creator: Serza
item.description:
Huh. And here I thought I saw it in the Steam version. Well, guess I mixed it up with HL2 :-/

item.title: has anyone done this before
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
GoldSrc had a wonderful glitch where music would play off the CD drive filling in for main game tracks, regardless of whether the disc in the drive was HL. So I wound up playing the cliffs area to Franz Ferdinand’s song 40’.

That was awesome.

Read full topic

wish this could be done with a won menu for steam hl i think someone has made a won menu for steam hl if you look in blue shift media folder it still has the logo.avi and sierra. avi and they both work

The Decay mod actually did that exact thing, only with a remixed version of the theme.
